children.el_text: On this screen, capture contact information for key stakeholders at McAfee and the customer who will be involved in the evaluation process. You may add up to 7 additional contacts into the McAfee and Partner Resources section, and up to 8 customer contacts. Only the contacts you authorize here will be able to log into the Use Case Manager.
McAfee Skyhigh and Partner Resources

McAfee Skyhigh is the leading choice for cloud security among many of the world's largest organizations.

Use this screen to designate the applications you may want to protect with McAfee Skyhigh Security Cloud. You may also identify up to 5 Custom Applications (remember to provide a name for the custom application). For more information on how McAfee Skyhigh protects each application, click on the related App Data Sheet to see detailed information.

AWS Related Use Cases
Audit AWS accounts to ensure they are configured per acceptable policies specified by the enterprise.

As enterprises migrate to AWS, they need to ensure it is configured per acceptable policies, for ISO, HIPAA, FedRAMP, ITAR, or internal compliance policies.

This is to ensure their compliance audits are successfully demonstrated with controls to secure any known risk taken in specific configurations of AWS.
Compromised Account, Insider Threat and Privilege Access Misuse Protection

Since AWS hosts a lot of customer facing business applications and workflow applications, an account compromise or insider threat incident could lead to huge damage to an enterprise. Given this, every enterprise wants to have best in class incident detection systems to detect and mitigate against data exfiltration.
Capture an audit trail of all user activity for forensic investigations
children.el_value: Capture an audit trail of all user activity for forensic investigations

children.el_text: A transactional log of every event as captured from AWS, across all accounts. This detailed audit trail can be invaluable for forensic analysis.
Azure Related Use Cases
Audit Azure accounts to ensure they are configured per acceptable policies specified by the enterprise.

As enterprises migrate to Azure, they need to ensure it is configured per acceptable policies, for ISO, HIPAA, FedRAMP, ITAR, or internal compliance policies.This is to ensure their compliance audits are successfully demonstrated with controls to secure any known risk taken in specific configurations of AWS.
Compromised Account, Insider Threat and Privilege Access Misuse Protection

Since Azure hosts a lot of customer facing business applications and workflow applications, an account compromise or insider threat incident could lead to huge damage to an enterprise. Given this, every enterprise wants to have best in class incident detection systems to detect and mitigate against data exfiltration.
Capture an audit trail of all user activity for forensic investigations
A transactional log of every event as captured from Azure, across all accounts. This detailed audit trail can be invaluable for forensic analysis.
Box Related Use Cases
Prevent unauthorized data from being shared with partners/collaborators

As organizations migrate to cloud services, it becomes increasingly difficult to control the aperture or distance data can flow to in the cloud. Most cloud services bring a wealth of collaboration capabilities designed to quickly distribute content both within and outside the organization. This introduces new risks to the Enterprise and controls are required to minimize the risk of sensitive data leaving the organization.
Prevent regulated/high-value data from being stored in the cloud.

It is important from a regulatory perspective to maintain control of what information can be stored in cloud service. Organizations must take care to prevent sensitive PII and IP from leaking from the company.
Capture an audit trail of all user activity for forensic investigations
A transactional log of every event as captured from the cloud service. This detailed audit trail can be invaluable for forensic analysis.
Detect compromised accounts, insider/privileged user threats, and protect against malicious content being spread via a cloud service.

Cloud services are at risk from internal and external threats. By tracking user activity and building a per use profile (user behavioral analytics) Skyhigh can help identify rouge internal and external users.
Block data from being exfiltrated to a personal device. Enforce access control policies

With BYOD being prominent in most enterprises today, our customers need the ability to identify mangage 'v' personal devices and restrict access from personal devices. Using either certificate or agent based device identification Skyhigh can provide a cloud access policy to control services users can access from personal devices.
Encrypt data stored in the cloud

The problem with storing sensitive data in the cloud is knowing who might have access to read the data. Encryption ensures that only authorized users are able to access the sensitive data. Encryption can be managed using enterprise-controlled encryption keys stored with the customer.
Scan for regulated/high-value data  stored in the cloud.

It is important from a regulatory perspective to maintain control of what information can be stored in cloud service. Organizations must take care to prevent sensitive PII and IP from leaking from the company.
Scan for malware stored in the cloud.
Having the ability to scan data at rest and detect any malware that might be out there before it becomes a problem for the organization is an essential step to maintain integrity with corporate data

Shadow IT Related Use Cases
Discover all cloud services including those that may not have been reviewed by Skyhigh.

In Skyhigh there is a feature called service groups.  Use this feature to create different groups of cloud services that may pose a risk to the organization. These may need to be monitored and/or controlled.
Display details risk assessments for cloud services and have the ability to add custom attributes to the risk registry
Detect data exfiltration and proxy leakage
Review CSP with data uploads and determine if blocking scripts are needed to prevent proxy leakage
Deep visibility for Shadow IT cloud services with SSL terminated logs from Firewall/Proxy
Enforce DLP policies against Advanced Shadow IT configuration. Ability to analyze SSL terminated logs to apply DLP polices
Review all CSP that own IP when transfered to the service and review all CSP that contribute to the darknet

Use Case Priority 01 Essential - AWS #1
Audit AWS accounts to ensure they are configured per acceptable policies specified by the enterprise.
children.el_value: Audit AWS accounts to ensure they are configured per acceptable policies specified by the enterprise.
children.el_formatted_value: Audit AWS accounts to ensure they are configured per acceptable policies specified by the enterprise.

children.el_text: As enterprises migrate to AWS, they need to ensure it is configured per acceptable policies, for ISO, HIPAA, FedRAMP, ITAR, or internal compliance policies.This is to ensure their compliance audits are successfully demonstrated with controls to secure any known risk taken in specific configurations of AWS.

children.el_formatted_value: Compromised Account, Insider Threat and Privilege Access Misuse Protection

children.el_text: Since AWS hosts a lot of customer facing business applications and workflow applications, an account compromise or insider threat incident could lead to huge damage to an enterprise. Given this, every enterprise wants to have best in class incident detection systems to detect and mitigate against data exfiltration.

children.el_text: As organizations migrate to cloud services, it becomes increasingly difficult to control the aperture or distance data can flow to in the cloud. Most cloud services bring a wealth of collaboration capabilities designed to quickly distribute content both within and outside the organization. This introduces new risks to the Enterprise and controls are required to minimize the risk of sensitive data leaving the organization.

children.el_text: With BYOD being prominent in most enterprises today, our customers need the ability to identify mangage 'v' personal devices and restrict access from personal devices. Using either certificate or agent based device identification Skyhigh can provide a cloud access policy to control services users can access from personal devices.

children.el_value: Encrypt data stored in the cloud
children.el_formatted_value: Encrypt data stored in the cloud

children.el_text: The problem with storing sensitive data in the cloud is knowing who might have access to read the data. Encryption ensures that only authorized users are able to access the sensitive data. Encryption can be managed using enterprise-controlled encryption keys stored with the customer.

Prevent unauthorized data from being shared with partners/collaborators

children.el_formatted_value: Prevent unauthorized data from being shared with partners/collaborators

children.el_text: As organizations migrate to cloud services, it becomes increasingly difficult to control the aperture or distance data can flow to in the cloud. Most cloud services bring a wealth of collaboration capabilities designed to quickly distribute content both within and outside the organization. This introduces new risks to the Enterprise and controls are required to minimize the risk of sensitive data leaving the organization.
Monitor and control data that is shared outside the organization.

children.el_text: The problem with storing sensitive data in the cloud is knowing who might have access to read the data. Encryption ensures that only authorized users are able to access the sensitive data. Encryption can be managed using enterprise-controlled encryption keys stored with the customer.
